data.chText: 动作
data.enText: of movement

data.chText: 优美；优雅
data.enText: an attractive quality of movement that is smooth, elegant and controlled

data.chText: 她的动作具有芭蕾舞演员自然优雅的丰姿。
data.enText: She moves with the natural grace of a ballerina.

data.chText: 行为
data.enText: behaviour

data.chText: 文雅；高雅
data.enText: a quality of behaviour that is polite and pleasant and deserves respect

data.chText: 在整个审讯过程中他表现得文雅而有尊严。
data.enText: He conducted himself with grace and dignity throughout the trial.

data.chText: 风度；体面
data.enText: ways of behaving that people think are polite and acceptable

data.chText: 他对社交礼节并不特别熟悉。
data.enText: He was not particularly well versed in the social graces .

data.chText: 额外时间
data.enText: extra time

data.chText: 宽限期；延缓期
data.enText: extra time that is given to sb to enable them to pay a bill, finish a piece of work, etc.

data.chText: 他们宽限我一个月弄到这笔钱。
data.enText: They've given me a month's grace to get the money.

data.chText: 上帝
data.enText: of God

data.chText: 恩宠；恩典
data.enText: the kindness that God shows towards the human race

data.chText: 承蒙天恩，他们才幸免于难。
data.enText: It was only by the grace of God that they survived.

data.chText: 祈祷
data.enText: prayer

data.chText: （饭前的）谢恩祈祷
data.enText: a short prayer that is usually said before a meal to thank God for the food

data.chText: 我们做饭前祷告吧。
data.enText: Let's say grace .

data.chText: 称呼
data.enText: title

data.chText: （对大主教、公爵、公爵夫人、女公爵的尊称）大人，阁下，夫人
data.enText: used as a title of respect when talking to or about an archbishop , a duke or a duchess

data.chText: 早上好，阁下。
data.enText: Good Morning, Your Grace.

data.chText: 肯特公爵及公爵夫人阁下。
data.enText: Their Graces the Duke and Duchess of Kent.
be in sb's good graces

data.chText: 为某人所赞同（或喜爱）；得到某人的欢心
data.enText: to have sb's approval and be liked by them
fall from grace

data.chText: （尤指因做了错事或不道德之事而）失去信任，失去尊重，失去恩宠
data.enText: to lose the trust or respect that people have for you, especially by doing sth wrong or immoral
sb's fall from grace

data.chText: （尤指因做了错事或不道德之事的）失去信誉
data.enText: a situation in which sb loses the trust or respect that people have for them, especially because of sth wrong or immoral that they have done
have the (good) grace to do sth

data.chText: （尤指犯错后）知趣地做某事，通情达理地做某事
data.enText: to be polite enough to do sth, especially when you have done sth wrong

data.chText: 他甚至连一丝尴尬的神色都没有。
data.enText: He didn't even have the grace to look embarrassed.
there but for the grace of God (go I)

data.chText: 若非天助，区区岂能幸免
data.enText: used to say that you could easily have been in the same difficult or unpleasant situation that sb else is in
with (a) bad grace

data.chText: 勉强地；不情愿地；无礼地
data.enText: in an unwilling and/or rude way

data.chText: 他照常不情愿地把钱交出来。
data.enText: He handed over the money with typical bad grace.
with (a) good grace

data.chText: 心甘情愿地；乐意地；高高兴兴地
data.enText: in a willing and pleasant way

data.chText: 你必须学会欣然承认失败。
data.enText: You must learn to accept defeat with good grace.
airs and graces

data.chText: 摆架子；装腔作势
data.enText: a way of behaving that shows that sb thinks that they are more important, etc. than they really are
in a state of grace

data.chText: （罗马天主教指灵魂上没有大罪的状态）受天主眷爱，蒙受恩宠
data.enText: (in the Roman Catholic Church) having been forgiven by God for the wrong or evil things you have done
year of grace
year of our Lord

data.chText: 纪元某年；公元某年
data.enText: any particular year after the birth of Christ

data.chText: 为增色；为锦上添花；装饰
data.enText: to make sth more attractive; to decorate sth

data.chText: 这张桌子曾一度为公爵的起居室增色不少。
data.enText: The table had once graced a duke's drawing room.

data.chText: 使荣耀；使生辉；承蒙光临
data.enText: to bring honour to sb/sth; to be kind enough to attend or take part in sth

data.chText: 她是曾使这运动生辉的最杰出的运动员之一。
data.enText: She is one of the finest players ever to have graced the game.

data.chText: 请问您今晚能否赏光？
data.enText: Will you be gracing us with your presence tonight?

simple_means.memory_skill: gra〔= grat〕令人高兴的；高雅 + ce → 高雅 → 文雅

data.enText: be in sb's good graces

data.chText: 为某人所赞同（或喜爱）；得到某人的欢心
data.enText: to have sb's approval and be liked by them
fall from grace

data.chText: （尤指因做了错事或不道德之事而）失去信任，失去尊重，失去恩宠
data.enText: to lose the trust or respect that people have for you, especially by doing sth wrong or immoral
sb's fall from grace

data.chText: （尤指因做了错事或不道德之事的）失去信誉
data.enText: a situation in which sb loses the trust or respect that people have for them, especially because of sth wrong or immoral that they have done
have the (good) grace to do sth

data.chText: （尤指犯错后）知趣地做某事，通情达理地做某事
data.enText: to be polite enough to do sth, especially when you have done sth wrong

data.chText: 他甚至连一丝尴尬的神色都没有。
data.enText: He didn't even have the grace to look embarrassed.
there but for the grace of God (go I)

data.chText: 若非天助，区区岂能幸免
data.enText: used to say that you could easily have been in the same difficult or unpleasant situation that sb else is in
with (a) bad grace

data.chText: 勉强地；不情愿地；无礼地
data.enText: in an unwilling and/or rude way

data.chText: 他照常不情愿地把钱交出来。
data.enText: He handed over the money with typical bad grace.
with (a) good grace

data.chText: 心甘情愿地；乐意地；高高兴兴地
data.enText: in a willing and pleasant way

data.chText: 你必须学会欣然承认失败。
data.enText: You must learn to accept defeat with good grace.
airs and graces

data.chText: 摆架子；装腔作势
data.enText: a way of behaving that shows that sb thinks that they are more important, etc. than they really are
in a state of grace

data.chText: （罗马天主教指灵魂上没有大罪的状态）受天主眷爱，蒙受恩宠
data.enText: (in the Roman Catholic Church) having been forgiven by God for the wrong or evil things you have done
year of grace
year of our Lord

data.chText: 纪元某年；公元某年
data.enText: any particular year after the birth of Christ

tr: a disposition to kindness and compassion
example: the victor's grace in treating the vanquished

tr: (Christian theology) the free and unmerited favor or beneficence of God
example: God's grace is manifested in the salvation of sinners
there but for the grace of God go I

tr: a sense of propriety and consideration for others
example: a place where the company of others must be accepted with good grace

tr: elegance and beauty of movement or expression
example: a beautiful figure which she used in subtle movements of unparalleled grace

tr: a short prayer of thanks before a meal
(Christian theology) a state of sanctification by God
the state of one who is under such divine influence
example: the conception of grace developed alongside the conception of sin
it was debated whether saving grace could be obtained outside the membership of the church
the Virgin lived in a state of grace

tr: make more attractive by adding ornament, colour, etc.
example: Decorate the room for the party
beautify yourself for the special day

value.def: If someone moves with grace, they move in a smooth, controlled, and attractive way.

example.ex: He moved with the grace of a trained boxer...
example.tran: 他的动作带着一种训练有素的拳击手的风采。

example.ex: Ballet classes are important for poise and grace.
example.tran: 芭蕾课可以很好地使人保持优雅的仪态。

value.def: If someone behaves with grace, they behave in a pleasant, polite, and dignified way, even when they are upset or being treated unfairly.

example.ex: The new King seemed to be carrying out his duties with grace and due decorum...
example.tran: 新国王在履行职责时看起来举止得体、端庄稳重。

example.ex: The young woman had grace beyond her years.
example.tran: 这个年轻女子有着超越年龄的涵养。

value.def: The graces are the ways of behaving and doing things which are considered polite and well-mannered.

example.ex: She didn't fit in and she had few social graces.
example.tran: 她不适合这种场合，对社交礼仪所知甚少。

value.def: Grace is used in expressions such as a day's grace and a month's grace to say that you are allowed that amount of extra time before you have to finish something.

example.ex: She wanted a couple of days' grace to get the maisonette cleaned before she moved in...
example.tran: 她想延缓几天，等到把这套复式公寓清理干净后再搬进去。

example.ex: We have only a few hours' grace before the soldiers come.
example.tran: 士兵到来之前我们只剩下几个小时了。

value.def: If you say that something graces a place or a person, you mean that it makes them more attractive.

example.ex: He went to the beautiful old Welsh dresser that graced this homely room...
example.tran: 他走到为这间舒适的房间增色不少的漂亮的旧威尔士碗橱前。

example.ex: Her shoulders were graced with mink and her fingers sparkled with diamonds.
example.tran: 肩上披着的貂皮衬托得她更加优雅，手上的钻戒则光彩夺目。

value.def: If you say that someone important will grace an event or an organization, you mean that they have agreed to be present at the event or to be part of the organization.

example.ex: He had been invited to grace a function at the evening college.
example.tran: 他应邀为这所夜校的活动捧场。

value.def: In Christianity and some other religions, grace is the kindness that God shows to people because he loves them.

example.ex: It was only by the grace of God that no one died.
example.tran: 承蒙上帝保佑才无人死亡。

value.def: When someone says grace before or after a meal, they say a prayer in which they thank God for the food and ask Him to bless it.

example.ex: Leo, will you say grace?
example.tran: 利奥，你来做饭前祷告吧？

example.ex: ...a Latin grace.
example.tran: 拉丁文的谢恩祷告

value.def: You use expressions such as Your Grace and His Grace when you are addressing or referring to a duke, duchess, or archbishop.

example.ex: Your Grace, I have a great favour to ask of you.
example.tran: 大人，我想请您施以大惠。

value.tran: （对公爵、公爵夫人或大主教的尊称）大人，阁下，夫人

value.def: If someone falls from grace, they suddenly stop being successful or popular.

example.ex: All went well at first, and I was in high favour; but presently I fell from grace...
example.tran: 我最初一帆风顺，备受器重，但现在却失宠了。

value.def: If someone has the good grace to do something, they are polite enough or honest enough to do it.

example.ex: He did not even have the grace to apologise...
example.tran: 他甚至连一个道歉都没有。

example.ex: Many of us do stupid things in our youth, but we should have the good grace to admit them.
example.tran: 我们很多人在年轻的时候都会干些糊涂事，但是，我们应该懂得承认错误。

value.tran: 通情达理地做;知趣地做

value.def: If you are talking about someone who is in a bad situation and you say 'There but for the grace of God go I', you mean that you are lucky not to be in the same situation as them and you feel sympathy for them.
value.tran: 若非上帝保佑，要不是我福大命大（我也会遭此不幸）

value.def: If you do something unpleasant with good grace or with a good grace, you do it cheerfully and without complaining. If you do something with bad grace or with a bad grace, you do it unwillingly and without enthusiasm.

example.ex: He accepted the decision with good grace, and wished me the very best of luck...
example.tran: 他欣然接受这一决定并祝我好运。

example.ex: With appallingly bad grace I packed up and we drove north.
example.tran: 我很不情愿地收拾好行囊，然后我们驱车向北开去。

value.tran: 情愿地/ 不情愿地；欣然地/不乐意地

value.def: If you are in someone's good graces, they are pleased with you.

example.ex: You're so eager to stay in the good graces of the King that nothing else matters to you.
example.tran: 你如此急于博得国王的欢心，以致其他事情都不管不顾了。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = pleasing, grace 令人高兴的；高雅
rootsaffixes.title: grat, gree

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 加强 + gree 令人高兴的；高雅 + able …的 → 非常高兴的 → 愉快的
gra〔= grat〕令人高兴的；高雅 + ce → 高雅 → 文雅
grac〔e〕优美，文雅 + ious …的 → 文雅的；亲切的
grate〔= grat〕令人高兴的；高雅 + ful …的 → 感谢的；愉快的
grat 令人高兴的；高雅 + ify 使 → 使〔人〕高兴
grat 令人高兴的；高雅 + itude 表状态 →〔别人做了〕令人高兴的事情 → 感激
来自gratuity“赠品”，赠品自然是免费的
grat 令人高兴的；高雅 + uity → 因高兴才给〔的东西〕→ 赏钱
in 不 + grat 令人高兴的；高雅 + e → 不高尚之人 → 忘恩负义之人
in 使… + grat 令人高兴的；高雅 + iate 做 → 使高兴 → 讨好
